qas.question: In what belief is God the creator and sustainer of the universe?
What does deism believe God's role in the universe is?

answers.text: the creator, but not the sustainer

qas.question: Which belief is that God is the universe?
Which belief system definitively believes in no Higher Power or Supreme Being?
Which belief system belives in some form of higher powwer, or something, but not organized religion?

answers.text: creator and sustainer of the universe
belief in the existence of one God
God is not believed to exist

plausible_answers.text: the creator and sustainer of the universe

qas.question: What two attributes describe God in deism?
In theism what does God not do regarding the universe?
According to monotheism, what does God consist of?
When you are an agnostic, what do you think doesn't exist?

plausible_answers.text: arguments for and against the existence of God

qas.question: What have many notable agnostics developed about pantheism?

context: In <a0_0>theism<a0_0/>, God is <b9_0>the <a5_0>creator and sustainer of the universe<b9_0/><a5_0/>, while in deism, God is <a1_0><a6_0>the creator<a6_0/>, but <b10_0>not the sustainer<b10_0/><a1_0/>, of the universe. Monotheism is the <a7_0>belief in the existence of one God<a7_0/> or in the oneness of God. In <a2_0>pantheism<a2_0/>, God is <b11_0>the universe itself<b11_0/>. In <a3_0>atheism<a3_0/>, <a8_0>God is not believed to exist<a8_0/>, while God is deemed unknown or unknowable within the context of <a4_0>agnosticism<a4_0/>. <b12_0>God<b12_0/> has also been conceived as being incorporeal (immaterial), a personal being, the source of all moral obligation, and the "greatest conceivable existent". Many notable philosophers have developed <b13_0>arguments for and against the existence of God<b13_0/>.
